entries.femaleVariant: Come over here.
I can sympathize.
Been wantin' to ask, actually… What happens 'zactly, y'know, when you reach past the Blackwall?
Know the feeling when you try to remember the address of a place you lived half your life but it just turns up... blank?
Your plan, exactly?
I have any guarantee you're tellin' the truth?
'K... say I believe you... What's the next step?
How am I to know this isn't an elaborate con? Be nice to have some kinda guarantee.
We go through with the mission, grab the neural matrix. While Reed and Alex grapple with Hansen, we make our getaway.
I can't give you one, sorry. But I've shown you my trust. I mean, you're free to sell me out to Reed, right? Or trust me enough to save us both. No guarantee for either of us – fair deal, I say.
Ahh… I guess that's all… I suppose you should call Reed, let 'im know all's set for the meet with Hansen.
Thanks, V... for trusting me.
This place – what makes it special?
So, what's so special about this place?
V, status report.
Reed, hey. I'm nova, thanks. How're you?
Locals come here after sunset. Fire up grills, crack open beers, talk about nothin' in particular.
All of it, every inch is special. Reminds me of Brooklyn – actually from there.
Just us here...?
Well… Here we are.
Sure we're alone? Wouldn't want any unpleasant surprises…
This spot – didn't pick it at random, I guess.
Not random, this place, is it?
No surprises. 'Cept maybe… you're already one of us – don't trust a soul.
Guessed right. Wanted to show you somethin'… Means a lot to me, it could help put some things in perspective.
Sounds... sounds painfully familiar. Think I know how ya feel.
Wouldn't mind hearing about it – Brooklyn.
entries.maleVariant: Wouldn't mind hearin' about it – Brooklyn.

entries.femaleVariant: Mmm… Got this memory... It was the night before I raided a Militech datafort.
I'm sittin' out on my fire escape, just lit a J. Down on the street, I see a party starting.

There's playful screams, laughter... Someone's blastin' funk from their stoop. I hear Willie, too – sells the best scopdogs around. He's shit-talkin' one of his chooms. And there's bonfire smoke in the air… Safe, familiar.
Were they celebratin' somethin'?
Yeah. A Thursday.
A snowflake lands on my glove, I can calculate its unique fractal structure... but what did my mom's voice sound like?
Sometimes, I– I lose control. Or get the sense I'm surrendering to someone else. But it feels horrible.
Mean, losin' your memory?
I need to get away. From Kurt, the NUSA, Reed... From everything.
And then...?
You help me skip town. I already cut a deal with a black clinic far, far from Night City.
Yeah. And more 'n' more, I get the sense someone's standing behind me... but there's never anyone there.
Put a cold beer in front of me once this is all over, then we'll have time to chat.
For now, fill me in on what you managed to get done.
You an' me, face to face.
And it means I trust you.
Lived just two blocks off… while I was here in NC on assignment.
What about Reed? Don't trust him?
You could just go home.
First time you've been honest with me.
Why not just go home?
Don't trust Reed? Guy wants to save your life.
Mhm. He "saved" me once already. Word of a botched hit on Militech crossed his desk, so he knocked on a nineteen-year-old girl's door with an offer she couldn't refuse.
That girl died that day. The person in front of you is what was born from that death.
Join and serve, or become a NetWatch trophy…
My home burned down when I was forced to trade warm Brooklyn brick for sterile Washington walls.
I have nowhere to go back to.
Get the feeling this's the first time you've been honest with me.
Yeah... With you and myself.
So NC – just the first stop along your escape route.
Hansen – great taste in allies right there.
Speakin' of… out of everybody out there, you saw Hansen as a trusty ally? Seriously?
entries.maleVariant: Speakin' of… out of everybody out there, you saw Hansen as a trusty ally... Seriously?

entries.femaleVariant: I needed someone who could tear me from Myers' grip. I knew him from my time in Night City, when I was posted here.
Took a steep risk all right. An' a plain gonk one at that.
That's why I enlisted you, too.
Night City's just a pit stop along your escape route. That was always the plan, wasn't it?
Yeah. It's just… things got complicated, messy.
Certainly didn't expect my old Agency chooms to get involved. Or to find myself caged by Kurt.
I'm fleeing, V. Gotta get out. And to do that, I need you. 'Cause you… you know how it is.
And... that's it. Everything. Like a weight off my shoulders, honestly. Now, I have to ask…
I doubt anyone understands this feeling as well you do, V.
You're the only one I can trust with this.
Only question is, after everything you just heard, you feel the same way about me?
We make mistakes, then live with the consequences.
Understand you and trust you.
I understand you, believe you, know what it's like to fight for your life, every minute of it.
Should be pretty clear I mean to survive, too.
Can't be both?
Wanna survive, just like you do.
Yes.
Gives you a new perspective, doesn't it?
I appreciate your honesty.
You'd fit right in in D.C. Just enough truth, but not too much.
I'll take what I can get.
Brooklyn – tell me about it.
You wanna go back.
Yearnin' to go back.
Nice to talk to you, too.
All set to to track the netrunners' car.
Talked to Songbird.
Alex and I wormed our way into the rental company's system. We're good to track the car.
Talk later.
Perfect. Send me the encryption key.
[Send encryption key]
Any second now...
V, one other thing... You need new chrome, an implant that accommodates behavioral imprints.
I'm sending you detes for a clinic. The doc'll be expectin' you.
Just tell the ripper you know she collects Unification War trinkets. She'll know you came with my blessin'.
So we're still waitin' for Songbird to notify us that the customer's ready to be served.
Still waiting on that.
I'll let you know.
Yup, still waitin'…
Call me soon as you hear from 'er.
Buzz ya soon as I know anything.
Good.
Song contacted me..
Talked to 'er already, actually.
Mh. Then bring me up to speed.
So Mi contacted me. Got news.
Let me hear it.
Well, first off, we been green lit. Our VIP's ready to be served.
Music to my ears... What else?
We need that car tracking, so get to work. We'll go from there.
Once you get the encryption key from their system, let me know immediately.
Got it. Excellent.
Can't rewind the clock, V.
By the time you realize you miss somethin', it's usually too late.
Burden of past mistakes – we both bear it. It ain't easy. Me for the biochip, you for the Blackwall.
You mean to say... it's my fault?
No. Just that, when you try to save yourself, it's usually someone else who pays the price.
entries.maleVariant: No, just that... when you try to save yourself, 's usually somebody else who pays the price.

entries.femaleVariant: Hm, yeah... Ain't that the brutal fuckin' truth.
You're in this because you understand me... or because I promised to save your life?
Was there a question in there?
Is there a grain of truth anywhere in this web of lies?
Truth…?
Home's where your people are, not some place.
Heywood, here in NC – that's my home.
Yeah, know the feelin'.
Know how ya feel... Wasn't anything like Brooklyn, my home, but…
Got a memory you cherish?
Never gets this peaceful where I'm from. Just know that wherever I am in the world, I feel like I'm walkin' Heywood's streets.
entries.maleVariant: Eh, never gets peaceful where I'm from. Just know that wherever I am in the world, feels like I'm walkin' Heywood's streets.

entries.femaleVariant: Got a place you hold close to your heart, too?
Not a place – that was always changin'. But people, sure... memories of "home."
Ask your questions, V.
I'm here, ready to talk.
What's happenin' to you, exactly?
I'll be waitin'.
I'd swing by here come evening sometimes.
Well, V, we're gonna need you at your best... and that is why...
I've managed to lift some locks on your Relic's firmware. The trinket should now show you what it can really do.
I can sympathize.
We make mistakes, then live with the consequences.
So NC – just the first stop along your escape route.
Hansen – great taste in allies right there.
Hey, I got the encryption key for Charon Exotics. Nice work.
Don't trust you, no, but I got no choice.
Can't say I trust you. But, potential reward outweighs the risks, so I've thrown my hat in.
I get it, totally. And despite what you might think of me, I appreciate your sincerity.
Attack on Myers – I know it was you.
Just be honest. Please.
Attack on Myers – you schemed it up with Hansen, I know that.
Songbird...? Need ya to be straight with me.
entries.maleVariant: Songbird...? Need you to be straight with me.

entries.femaleVariant: 'Course, Reed… he died too. Just more recently – seven years ago.
The NUS issued his death sentence, yet he serves the country to this day, clinging to somethin' that's lost all meaning to me.
Help me understand why.
Still don't understand why. Wasn't any other way, honestly?
Always got a choice.
Always got a choice, Song. Always.
For Myers, the NUSA... I'm just another weapon in their arsenal. A tool for reachin' beyond the Blackwall.
And weapons and tools? They don't get to make decisions or choose to retire.
Didn't. Not this time.
Songbird opened up a bit… 'bout her sitch.
I hear you, I do… All the more reason to focus on the mission in front of us. Get our hands on that cure.
It's lookin' bad, real bad. This tech's her only shot.
Nothin' went according to plan. What a fuckin' mess.
You betrayed 'er.
Not just her…
Felt it too, with the Chimera... Like a livin' nightmare.
Wouldn't've resorted to this if there was.
Ahh… s'pose we should get back to the here 'n' now.
Yeah, neural matrix waaas pricey. But honestly, I... I never thought he'd try to kill 'er.
I… I helped Hansen spring the trap on Myers. My end of the deal… in exchange for the neural matrix.
What'd you envision?
Sent Myers' entire flight crew to an early grave. Myers herself, too, almost.
Lots of people died 'cause of you.
So what was your plan?
Ground the plane – that was the plan. Didn't expect he'd… blow it to shit.
Not much of an excuse, I know.
I fucked everything up, I know, V… but I had no choice.
For you to rescue Myers while I secured the AI matrix. And for us to run. All before Kurt caught on.
Now Hansen's changed the terms of our deal. They'll make 'im answer for the attack, he knows that, so he's coverin' his ass.
Says that's my ticket to freedom, but… soon as he gets his hands on it, I'm dead, I just know it.
I'd down the plane, deliver Myers, yes. But blast her outta the sky, then hunt 'er down? Wasn't what we agreed.
The one thing he doesn't know is what's on the Cynosure mainframe. He's hopin' it's data he can use as leverage against the NUS.
Yeah, neural matrix waaas pricey. But honestly, I... I never thought he'd try to kill 'er.
Attack on Myers – you schemed it up with Hansen, I know that.
I'd down the plane, deliver Myers, yes. But blast her outta the sky, then hunt 'er down? Wasn't what we agreed.
I… I helped Hansen spring the trap on Myers. My end of the deal… in exchange for the neural matrix.
Songbird...? Need ya to be straight with me.
There, the rippers can access the matrix and use an algorithm to create a prototype of our cure.
Reed… She had a lot to say.
But Reed… What So Mi spilled… We really need to talk.
I know. But later, not a topic for the holo.
They'll need me present to run their tests. The moment they're finished, I'll send word.
Call ya back later.
